title: ISic000823. Statue base for Hieron II of Syracuse
body:
1Βασιλέος ἁγε [μόνος]
2̒Ιέρωνος Ἱεροκλέος
3Συρακόσιοι θεοῖς πᾶσι

1ΒΑΣΙΛΕΟΣΑΓΕ[.....]
2̒ΙΕΡΩΝΟΣΙΕΡΟΚΛΕΟΣ
3ΣΥΡΑΚΟΣΙΟΙΘΕΟΙΣΠΑΣΙ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Kaibel (IG);
  • Line.1: ἁγε[ομένου], Dittenberger

English translation

Jonathan Prag

The Syracusans (dedicate this statue) of the king and hegemon Hieron, son of Hierokles, to all the gods

commentary

As John Ma, Statues and Cities (Oxford 2013) 20 n.27 notes, this is an anomalous instance of an honorific dedication where the honorand is in the genitive

  • Libertini 1929 123 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001872
  • De Sensi Sestito 1977 82 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002043
  • Dimartino 2006 no.1.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002022
  • Dimartino 2017 241-246 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003125
  • Prag 2017 122 fig.5 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001664
